author: Staff Reporter
text:
To ensure 100 per cent polling in all the six assembly constituencies in the district, awareness stickers with messages on the importance of voting and polling date were pasted on buses, mini buses, autorickshaws and packaged drinking water cans here.

District Election Officer and Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy inaugurated the campaign. The Collector said that public transport vehicles would reach most of the villages in the district and help create awareness. Likewise, stickers were pasted on packaged drinking water cans at a private water bottling plant in Paramathi Velur. Officials said that the cans were distributed to households in the constituency and hence the message would reach homes easily.

Returning Officer Namakkal Assembly Constituency and Revenue Divisional Officer M. Kannan, Returning Officer for Paramathi Velur Assembly Constituency and District Backward Welfare Officer N. Ramakrishnan, District Civil Supplies and Consumer Protection Officer Kavikumar, Namakkal Municipal Commissioner Senthil Murugan and revenue officials were present.
title: Stickers on water cans, buses to create voter awareness
